left.heading: Grants
left.subheading: The Filecoin Foundation awards funding to critical development projects to foster a more robust and efficient decentralized web through the Filecoin ecosystem.

cards.title: Open Grants
cards.description: Have an idea for pushing the Filecoin ecosystem forward? Grants of up to $30,000 USD are available to support projects that advance the Filecoin ecosystem, scale users, or directly advance Filecoin’s mission to preserve humanity’s most important information.

cards.title: Request for Proposal
cards.description: These grants generally have clearly scoped deliverables, milestones, and funding limits. While there is some flexibility in RFP deliverables, we expect teams will deliver what is in scope in the RFP.

cards.title: Microgrants
cards.description: The Filecoin Foundation awards grants to early-stage projects that have developed initial protocols using Filecoin.
For more information on grants, email us.

left.label: Our Mission
left.description: The foundation’s key role is to find ways for the Filecoin community to solve the problems we face as a community, and help facilitate collective action.

slides.label: Education
slides.description: These projects fall into two broad categories.  The first category seeks to educate the public about how the internet works and how decentralized and open source technologies benefit businesses, citizens, and governments.  The second category seeks to educate and support current and future developers in how to best use decentralized and open technologies.

slides.label: Research
slides.description: These projects support efforts to store research data using decentralized web storage in ways that make the data easily shared and accessed. Additionally, they explore methods to improve and expand decentralized web data retrieval and storage with outputs that are freely and publicly accessible.

slides.label: Development
slides.description: These projects drive the creation and development of technologies that will enable decentralized file storage of humanity’s most important information. They may encourage and fund the essential interoperability glue connecting elements of the decentralized web.
